title: Can you develop respect for someone you love, who currently you have no respect for? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes. You can respect them as a human, who thinks and feels and has insecurities and talents, and is worthy at the very least of being allowed to keep his or her dignity. I spent much of my life at odds with my own father; he has many issues that make him unhealthy for me to spend much time around. There was even a time when I claimed that I hated him. But when he was hurt badly in a car accident, my heart softened toward him. I was suddenly reminded that he feels pain, too, that many of his struggles are outside of his control, and that I was missing out on having a relationship with my baby brothers (24 and 26 years younger than me) who will probably need help coping with having him as a father as they get older.

Yes! All you have to do is love them. Sounds confusing—right? But it shouldn’t be. What’s confusing is your question. How is it possible to love someone but not respect them? How do you separate respect from love? I suspect that you don’t really love this person at all. Perhaps you just have a crush on them because of their appearance. And perhaps as you’re getting to know them better, you are seeing a lot of things that you don’t like about them. Sorry, buy your infatuation isn’t going to be enough for you to overcome the things that you don’t like about this person. Nor should you allow that to happen. If you can’t respect someone, then you’re never really going to love them.

I don’t believe respect can be rebuilt once lost .Never knowing someone yes respect can be built , certainly not love them respect.If you would have asked me this question 1 year ago I would have said the opposite.I once fell in love but lacked respect for said person after hearing about the horrendous things they had done .Today I am no longer blinded but love upfront , it takes a fine check list to pass my barriers that are twice as thick and 10 times as high as ever before .Respect first then maybe Love next
